subject: Re: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: Yep -- go to the project properties, Java Build Path Pick the Source folders tab, and either create or add existing folders Add one for src/java and one for
messageBody:
Yep -- go to the project properties, Java Build Path

Pick the Source folders tab, and either create or add existing folders

Add one for src/java and one for src/tests


Works like a charm for me... feel free to contact me directly if you wish...

Ken


At 05:59 PM 11/13/2002 +0000, you wrote:
>Hi,
>
>Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
>whose junit code is organized as follows:
>
> src/
> java/
> a/b/c
> test/
> a/b/c
>
>I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
>shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
>in src/java
>
>Bill de h√ìra
>
